It is true that readers may have differing preferences when it comes to the level of detail given in a novel. However, it is also important to recognize that each writer has their own unique style and approach to storytelling.

In the case of "Wuthering Heights," Emily Bronte's style of writing and her use of detailed description of the setting is an intentional choice. Her poetic language and attention to detail serve to add layers of meaning and depth to the story's themes and characters.

While some readers may find Bronte's style challenging, others may find it enhances their reading experience by immersing them more fully in the world of the novel. Ultimately, the author's style and approach to the story are subjective and may be appreciated differently by different readers.

In summary, while some readers may prefer a more succinct and straightforward storytelling approach, others may appreciate the immersive and atmospheric qualities of Emily Bronte's writing style that include detailed descriptions of the setting in "Wuthering Heights."
